name: Sultan Hostel

reviews.text: We spent the first night in a dorm and then moved to private room when one became available. We were fortunate that our room was to the side of the hostel so noise was kept to a minimum. Some friends had a private room directly over the bar area and struggled to get to sleep.... Music was very loud until 3 am most days.
reviews.title: Affordable

reviews.text: Good value for money in good location. Only critisim is tours suggested by front desk are not the best value at all. Definitely look around, particularly the turkish spa they suggest. It is very poor compared to the other spa's....
reviews.title: Great Atmosphere

reviews.text: Great for socialising and meeting new people. Bar staff very attentive and helpful
reviews.title: Super Fun Hostel

reviews.text: Showers were quite dirty though so just be prepared with wet area shoes (flip flops).
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: I stayed with a friend in the 20 bed dorm for 9 days. The room was not crowded, despite all those beds, and had access to both a small balcony on the front of the building and a the rooftop terrace. The bathrooms were in a constant state of flooding due to maintenance issues in the showers, but that was really my only complaint. The staff was amazing. They really made the experience. Really, the whole street was awesome. Music and laughter and food and shisha. Everyone from all the hostels and restaurants seemed to know each other so they just hung out with each other and with the patrons. It was a great place to just relax and enjoy your vacation. The breakfast was filling (breads and jam, cucumbers, tomatoes, cheese, olives, coffee, and tea). And the hostel's restaurant wasn't half bad either. The lockers were free and were right in front of reception. The location was within walking distance of all the major sites. I loved this hostel and I would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Sultan S'alright

reviews.text: Nice staying, not noisy, simple, clean enough and good environment. Staff was very helpfull, helped us book hostel in other parts of Turkey. Very nice front bar/restaurante where you can chill and smoke some shisha. Not super great, but nice to chill and stay a couple of days.
reviews.title: Good breakfast, simple rooms & wonderfull restaurant/bar at the front

reviews.text: Arriving at Sirkeci train station, exhausted after a sleepless train journey, at 6 in the morning was not ideal. Being able to easily find Sultan hostel and sit outside in the bar on its comfy sofas drinking free coffee until check-in time was much better. The rooms (we stayed in the large 26 bed "Harem" on the way through Istanbul to Asia and a 6 bed room on the way back) are clean with lovely white sheets and nice bunks. The 26 bed dorm got quite stuffy as it didn't have air conditioning (we made do with some huge fans) but the smaller rooms do have air-con. Breakfast comprises of a good selection of foods and you can eat it sitting out in the outdoor bar on the bustling street. The location is excellent - you're just under Sultanahmet and 5 minutes walk from the Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque. There's a train station a couple of minutes away to the east (towards the Bosphorus) and tram stops up in the square between the Aya Sofya and Blue Mosque.
reviews.title: Fantastic location/rooms and, for the most part, facilities

reviews.text: The main problem with this hostel lay with the bathroom facilities. There was only one shower and one toilet per floor shared between maybe 6 rooms (so potentially 36 people). The ground floor, which had the 26 bed dorm, had 2 showers/toilets, but the situation wasn't much better. This led to overflowing of toilet paper in the bins (couldn't flush toilet paper down toilets) and hot, muggy shower rooms.
reviews.title: an unforgettable experience

reviews.text: when you are a sultan hostel you are among good hands, in a family atmosphere in the heart of an extraordinary city.
reviews.title: Great hostel

reviews.text: everything you need is in your hands: an excelent service, clean room and maintained, what to eat and drink ... and all this at very interesting prices. especially that Sultan Hostel is placed in the heart of the historic town very close to Hajia Sofia, the blue mosque, the hyporome ...
reviews.title: Great location, clean, very helpful staff

reviews.text: Stayed here for two days in late May in a 6 bed mixed room. The hostel is everything it says it is - it's in a superb location, has a decent bar/restaurant with a good breakfast, and is great for meeting other travelers. The rooms are clean, the staff is super friendly, and it seems everything one needs for a pleasant stay is right here. One area that could be improved upon is the bathrooms - and only because there is no place to hang your towel/clothes when showering. Otherwise, a great stay. If in Istanbul again, I would definitely come back. Thanks!
reviews.title: Great hostel for value, quality and meeting other travelers

reviews.text: A really good hostel, with a fantastic location right in amongst many bars and restaurants, and very close to famous sites such as the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. Staff are very friendly (and funny!) and helpful. Rooms are clean, not overly crowded and also fitted with air conditioning, pretty unusual for a hostel. Good bathrooms. Minor drawback is that there is no kitchen facility, so if you're want to do your own cooking, then you might want to look somewhere else. Otherwise, highly recommended hostel :)!!
reviews.title: Highly recommended, great location

reviews.text: Parts of the hostel are really good:
reviews.title: Mixed

reviews.text: - the beds, the lockers, the common room, the location.
reviews.title: A very sociable hostel

reviews.text: However, the overall experience is let down by the very poor initial directions to the hostel - Its trial and error really. The place wasn't particularly unclean but it would have been nice had the bin for toilet paper (you can't flush it) been emptied every day when there are 6+ people in a room.
reviews.title: A great hostel

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights in early September -- as part of a group of four -- in a six-person dorm and was impressed by the cleanliness of the rooms and shared bath facilities.
reviews.title: Very clean option in good location

reviews.text: Although some previous commenters have said it's a pain that there's only one shower per floor, it's not really a problem as you can just use the facilities on a different floor. The hostel was quite full and we didn't wait long at all to take a shower.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Istambul

reviews.text: Breakfast is simple, but fresh and plentiful with decent hours.
reviews.title: Good location & friendly staff

reviews.text: The bar beneath the hostel is quite popular so some noise is to be expected in rooms, but I found the noise to be dull and did not prevent sleeping. Also, all rooms have a/c so the noise can be dulled even further by keeping the window(s) shut.
reviews.title: Great choice for budget, social travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One disappointment was that the hostel's web site still advertises a roof terrace, but, like many other hostels in the area, this roof terrace has been turned into a giant dormitory. Don't come expecting sea views from the roof.
reviews.title: Basic rooms but great location

description: Be smart, stay smart! Our mission is to provide comfortable, stylish, convenient and affordable accommodation in Istanbul at a price that can’t be beat. Our location is designed with the backpacker in mind. From our 24-hour reception to security lockers , we have everything you need to enjoy your stay and feel comfortable. SULTAN HOSTEL IS THE ONLY HOSTEL WHERE YOU CAN WATCH RUGBY GAMES LIVE ON BIG SCREEN TV AND ALSO ENGLISH PREMIER LEAGUE IN ENGLISH Our hostel is also regularly health and safety checked by the local governments. If you have not satisfied with your stay for any reasons, we take your comments and suggestions seriously. We encourage you to speak to your dedicated and highly-trained staff to help us improve our hostels. We will work our hardest to make it a pleasant stay, whether one night or a month! As part of the Youth Hostel Association and the International Youth Hostel Federation. We are right in the heart of a young, international area full of shops, cafes, restaurants and bars, this YHA property buzzes with action. We are the perfect stop on your backpacker trail of Istanbul. Our rooms are with or without Bathroom and Breakfast Included. Our hostel is centrally located in Sultanahmet and is just a few minutes walk from all the major attractions. On our big screen TV.You can watch the latest movies and watch all sports activitivies including, Rugby, Premier League, Tennis, golf. Some of our facilities are; Reasonable prices, Clean comfortable rooms, 24 hour piping hot water, No curfew, Friendly, helpful English speaking staff, Great food, Relaxed Bar, Lockers for your valuables. Free internet access, wireless internet, home tether, free towels, breakfast included, travel agency, sea view terrace in summerThe Sultan Hostel is a short walk to all the main sights including, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Underground Cistern, the Grand Bazaar and Topkapi Palace.
